page.title: 03Housing-village of Risby
page.content: RISBY. One corner of the surveyed area includes a part of the village of RISBY which is a traditional Suffolk village in close proximity to a growing town. The village has grown in recent years with the addition of modern private housing in some cases forming small estates. The nucleus of the traditional village remains intact centring on the village green. The church, on the other hand, is towards the eastern edge of the village indicating a shift of population at some time in the development of the village. Some village residents living in older properties make considerable efforts to maintain the traditional character of their properties. These properties are houses of the timber-frame (or half-timbered) type dating back to the 15th and 16th centuries.
